pages.text: To produce combs, bees need specific 'flowers' nearby, which tend to be plants native to whatever biomes the bees are native to. However, some species require slightly more exotic blocks to produce combs - regular flowers, azaleas, dead shrubs and even skulls are all potentially flowers that bee species might need.
You can get an overview of what blocks count as what flowers by checking the uses of an apiary/mellarium or searching the flower name in a recipe viewer.
